page.title: 15The Sawmill 1.
page.content: The firm is situated in Cowbridge on the outskirts of Timberscombe at the junction of the B396 with the Wootton Courtenay road. The business is run by Mr. K. Grabham and the property is rented from Mr. D. Huxtable. Mr. Grabham's father was originally the village blacksmith and wheelwright with premises in the centre of Timberscombe. Although his chosen profession was that of butcher, he gave that up at the age of 18 to assist his father.They provided a service for a wide area including Timberscombe, Cutcombe, Luxborough and Dunster Castle. In 1932 the blacksmiths moved to Cowbridge to new premises adjoining the sawmill. They took over the business of the sawmill in 1937.There was a greater variety of work then than now.Carts were built there and barn threshers.Now the work
